questions.question:
In the simplest terms, a(n) ___ is a device that accepts input, processes data, and can output or store the result of its actions.
computer · network · LBS · cloud

NASA uses ___ to conduct complex modeling and simulations for upcoming missions.
network servers · supercomputers · mainframe computers · all-in-one computers

___, such as Windows or macOS, exist primarily to help the computer run and manage its resources.
Operating systems · Processors · Cloud drives · Networks

___ is the gathering of information from a large group of people.
Group networking · Crowdsourcing · Collaborative computing · LBS

Which of the following refers to the ability of a computer to perform a variety of actions based on instructions from the user or a program?
input · processing · output · storage

A(n) ___ allows users to communicate and share information between computers.
streaming media player · information processing cycle · network · NFC

Many computers are now being connected via ___ networks, whereby communication takes place using radio waves.
personal · multimedia · augmented · wireless

This family of network protocols is the current standard for wireless networks that connect to the Internet.
BLE · DNS · Wi-Fi · WWW

With ___ storage services, your files can be stored online and accessed from any internet-connected device.
cloud · mobile · multimedia · augmented

In order to save space, some large, multi-user environments use thin units called ___ servers which can slide in and out of an enclosure that holds many of its companion servers.
blade · mainframe · embedded · cloud

The ability to communicate with a device without using your hands is known as ___ computing.
augmented · hands-free · wearable · cloud

Which of the following is a feature on your mobile device that allows the Yelp app to provide a list of restaurants that are close to you?
Location-based services · Real-time information · Crowdsourcing · MMS

In ___ reality, the real-world is supplemented with computer-generated information.
virtual · digital · augmented · smart

Using a wireless technology known as ___, many smartphones can now be tapped on special payment devices to complete your purchase at select stores.
Bluetooth · SMS · Wi-Fi · NFC

Many mobile devices contain a(n) ___ and gyroscope that can sense even the smallest movements.
GPS · LBS · accelerometer · scanner

Apple's ___ and Google's Assistant are two products that respond to a variety of voice commands on mobile devices.
iVoice · Air · Siri · iMac

Which of the following apps would you use if you were travelling to a country where they did not speak your language?
TikTok · Google Translate · Strava · Pandora

Which of the following is a popular service that will play music based on your personal preferences?
Hulu · Pandora · Netflix · Instagram

Which of the following is an example of a "music locker" service that allows you to upload your own music for streaming at a later time?
Spotify · YouTube Music · Hulu · Netflix

Which of the following is NOT a mobile payment service that allows you to send money to other individuals?
Zelle · Venmo · CashApp · Strava

final-jeopardy.question: This messaging app with over 2 billion global users has become a favorite worldwide as a substitute for SMS.
